Docs.summary: Configurations of a Disaster Recovery Details.

Docs.summary: Indicates the disaster recovery (DR) type of the Autonomous Database Serverless instance. Autonomous Data Guard (ADG) DR type provides business critical DR with a faster recovery time objective (RTO) during failover or switchover. Backup-based DR type provides lower cost DR with a slower RTO during failover or switchover.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool? IsReplicateAutomaticBackups { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> IsReplicateAutomaticBackups
Public Property IsReplicateAutomaticBackups As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.IsReplicateAutomaticBackups : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: If true, 7 days worth of backups are replicated across regions for Cross-Region ADB or Backup-Based DR between Primary and Standby. If false, the backups taken on the Primary are not replicated to the Standby database.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool? IsSnapshotStandby { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> IsSnapshotStandby
Public Property IsSnapshotStandby As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.IsSnapshotStandby : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates if user wants to convert to a snapshot standby. For example, true would set a standby database to snapshot standby database. False would set a snapshot standby database back to regular standby database.

MemberSignature.Value: public DateTimeOffset? TimeSnapshotStandbyEnabledTill { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTimeOffset> TimeSnapshotStandbyEnabledTill
Public Property TimeSnapshotStandbyEnabledTill As Nullable(Of DateTimeOffset)
member this.TimeSnapshotStandbyEnabledTill : Nullable<DateTimeOffset> with get, set

Docs.summary: Time and date stored as an RFC 3339 formatted timestamp string. For example, 2022-01-01T12:00:00.000Z would set a limit for the snapshot standby to be converted back to a cross-region standby database.
